alert.note: Alert for Wallace (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 19 at 4:35PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of west central Kansas, including the following county, Wallace. * WHEN...Until 800 AM MDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 333 PM MDT, local law enforcement reported flooding in multiple locations near and long the Smokey Hill River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sharon Springs and Wallace. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
